Shame! Chinese Zoo 'Glues' Basket On Tortoise's Back For Tourists To Throw Money In It

Shame! Chinese Zoo 'Glues' Basket On Tortoise's Back For Tourists To Throw Money In It

Cases of animal cruelty are increasing, be it animals tortured or they are beaten to death. Recently, images of a tortoise at a Chinese zoo with a basket ‘glued’ to its shell for tourists to throw money in.

The photos that are viral shows visitors at the Nanning zoo in Guangxi, throwing coins at the African spurred tortoise, which has a basket and a Chinese flag attached to it. The pictures of the tortoise was shared on Chinese social media.

The post accused the zoo of animal cruelty and trying to make money out of the tourists and also urged the National Forestry Bureau and state media to investigate the matter. The post also said that the tortoise was being kept in a very bad environment.

Speaking to Pear Video, he said: "I don't know why the zoo would use this method to exhibit precious animals."

The zoo is now investigating the matter, according to the Daily Mail.

Although, throwing coins is considered to be good luck in China but that should never be the case at the cost of an animal's safety.
